00060 
00062 void
00063 SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::update_from_section(SgAsmElfSection *section)
00064 {
00065     set_offset(section->get_offset());
00066     set_filesz(section->get_size());
00067     set_vaddr(section->get_mapped_preferred_va());
00068     set_memsz(section->get_mapped_size());
00069     set_align(section->is_mapped() ? section->get_mapped_alignment() : section->get_file_alignment());
00070 
00071     if (section->get_mapped_rperm()) {
00072         set_flags((SegmentFlags)(p_flags | PF_RPERM));
00073     } else {
00074         set_flags((SegmentFlags)(p_flags & ~PF_RPERM));
00075     }
00076     if (section->get_mapped_wperm()) {
00077         set_flags((SegmentFlags)(p_flags | PF_WPERM));
00078     } else {
00079         set_flags((SegmentFlags)(p_flags & ~PF_WPERM));
00080     }
00081     if (section->get_mapped_xperm()) {
00082         set_flags((SegmentFlags)(p_flags | PF_XPERM));
00083     } else {
00084         set_flags((SegmentFlags)(p_flags & ~PF_XPERM));
00085     }
00086 
00087     if (isSgAsmElfNoteSection(section)) {
00088         set_type(PT_NOTE);
00089     }
00090 }

00093 void
00094 SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00095 {
00096     char p[4096];
00097     if (idx>=0) {
00098         sprintf(p, "%sElfSegmentTableEntry[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00099     } else {
00100         sprintf(p, "%sElfSegmentTableEntry.", prefix);
00101     }
00102     const int w = std::max(1, DUMP_FIELD_WIDTH-(int)strlen(p));
00103 
00104     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %zu\n",                             p, w, "index",  p_index);
00105     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x = %s\n",                     p, w, "type",   p_type,  to_string(p_type).c_str());
00106     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x ",                           p, w, "flags",  p_flags);
00107     fputc(p_flags & PF_RPERM ? 'r' : '-', f);
00108     fputc(p_flags & PF_WPERM ? 'w' : '-', f);
00109     fputc(p_flags & PF_XPERM ? 'x' : '-', f);
00110     if (p_flags & PF_OS_MASK) fputs(" os", f);
00111     if (p_flags & PF_PROC_MASK) fputs(" proc", f);
00112     if (p_flags & PF_RESERVED) fputs(" *", f);
00113     fputc('\n', f);
00114     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes into file\n", p, w, "offset", p_offset, p_offset);
00115     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")\n",                 p, w, "vaddr",  p_vaddr, p_vaddr);
00116     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")\n",                 p, w, "paddr",  p_paddr, p_paddr);
00117     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes\n",           p, w, "filesz", p_filesz, p_filesz);
00118     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes\n",           p, w, "memsz",  p_memsz, p_memsz);
00119     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes\n",           p, w, "align",  p_align, p_align);
00120     if (p_extra.size()>0) {
00121         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %zu bytes\n", p, w, "extra", p_extra.size());
00122         hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"extra at ", p_extra);
00123     }
00124 }

00136 
00137 std::string
00138 SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::to_string(SegmentFlags val)
00139 {
00140     std::string str;
00141     for( size_t i=0; (1u << i) <= PF_RPERM; ++i){
00142         if( i!= 0)
00143             str += ' ';
00144         if(val & (1 << i)){
00145             switch(1 << i){
00146                 case PF_XPERM: str += "EXECUTE";break;
00147                 case PF_WPERM: str += "WRITE"; break;
00148                 case PF_RPERM: str += "READ";break;
00149             };
00150         }
00151     }
00152     uint32_t os   = (val & ~(uint32_t)(PF_OS_MASK));
00153     uint32_t proc = (val & ~(uint32_t)(PF_PROC_MASK));
00154     uint32_t rest = (val & ~(uint32_t)(PF_RESERVED));
00155 
00156     if(os){
00157         char buf[64];
00158         snprintf(buf,sizeof(buf),"os flags(%2x)", os >> 20);
00159         str += buf;    
00160     }
00161 
00162     if(proc){
00163         char buf[64];
00164         snprintf(buf,sizeof(buf),"proc flags(%1x)", proc >> 28);
00165         str += buf;    
00166     }
00167 
00168     if(rest){
00169         char buf[64];
00170         snprintf(buf,sizeof(buf),"unknown(%x)", rest);
00171         str += buf;
00172     }
00173 
00174     return str;
00175 
00176 }

00178 
00180 void
00181 SgAsmElfSegmentTable::ctor()
00182 {
00183     /* There can be only one ELF Segment Table */
00184     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());
00185     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr);
00186     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr->get_segment_table()==NULL);
00187     fhdr->set_segment_table(this);
00188     
00189     set_synthesized(true);                              /* the segment table isn't part of any explicit section */
00190     set_name(new SgAsmBasicString("ELF Segment Table"));
00191     set_purpose(SP_HEADER);
00192 
00193     fhdr->set_segment_table(this);
00194 }
00195 
00198 SgAsmElfSegmentTable *
00199 SgAsmElfSegmentTable::parse()
00200 {
00201     SgAsmGenericSection::parse();
00202 
00203     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());
00204     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr!=NULL);
00205     ByteOrder sex = fhdr->get_sex();
00206 
00207     size_t ent_size, struct_size, opt_size, nentries;
00208     calculate_sizes(&ent_size, &struct_size, &opt_size, &nentries);
00209     ROSE_ASSERT(opt_size==fhdr->get_phextrasz() && nentries==fhdr->get_e_phnum());
00210 
00211     /* If the current size is very small (0 or 1 byte) then we're coming straight from the constructor and the parsing should
00212      * also extend this section to hold all the entries. Otherwise the caller must have assigned a specific size for a good
00213      * reason and we should leave that alone, reading zeros if the entries extend beyond the defined size. */
00214     if (get_size()<=1 && get_size()<nentries*ent_size)
00215         extend(nentries*ent_size - get_size());
00216     
00217     rose_addr_t offset=0;                                /* w.r.t. the beginning of this section */
00218     for (size_t i=0; i<nentries; i++, offset+=ent_size) {
00219         /* Read/decode the segment header */
00220         SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry *shdr = NULL;
00221         if (4==fhdr->get_word_size()) {
00222             SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::Elf32SegmentTableEntry_disk disk;
00223             read_content_local(offset, &disk, struct_size);
00224             shdr = new SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry(sex, &disk);
00225         } else {
00226             SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::Elf64SegmentTableEntry_disk disk;
00227             read_content_local(offset, &disk, struct_size);
00228             shdr = new SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry(sex, &disk);
00229         }
00230         shdr->set_index(i);
00231         if (opt_size>0)
00232             shdr->get_extra() = read_content_local_ucl(offset+struct_size, opt_size);
00233 
00234         /* Null segments are just unused slots in the table; no real section to create */
00235         if (SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_NULL == shdr->get_type())
00236             continue;
00237 
00238         /* Create SgAsmElfSection objects for each ELF Segment. However, if the ELF Segment Table describes a segment
00239          * that's the same offset and size as a section from the Elf Section Table (and the memory mappings are
00240          * consistent) then use the preexisting section instead of creating a new one. */
00241         SgAsmElfSection *s = NULL;
00242         SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList possible = fhdr->get_file()->get_sections_by_offset(shdr->get_offset(), shdr->get_filesz());
00243         for (size_t j=0; !s && j<possible.size(); j++) {
00244             if (possible[j]->get_offset()!=shdr->get_offset() || possible[j]->get_size()!=shdr->get_filesz())
00245                 continue; /*different file extent*/
00246             if (possible[j]->is_mapped()) {
00247                 if (possible[j]->get_mapped_preferred_rva()!=shdr->get_vaddr() ||
00248                     possible[j]->get_mapped_size()!=shdr->get_memsz())
00249                     continue; /*different mapped address or size*/
00250                 unsigned section_perms = (possible[j]->get_mapped_rperm() ? 0x01 : 0x00) |
00251                                          (possible[j]->get_mapped_wperm() ? 0x02 : 0x00) |
00252                                          (possible[j]->get_mapped_xperm() ? 0x04 : 0x00);
00253                 unsigned segment_perms = (shdr->get_flags() & SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PF_RPERM ? 0x01 : 0x00) |
00254                                          (shdr->get_flags() & SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PF_WPERM ? 0x02 : 0x00) |
00255                                          (shdr->get_flags() & SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PF_XPERM ? 0x04 : 0x00);
00256                 if (section_perms != segment_perms)
00257                     continue; /*different mapped permissions*/
00258             }
00259 
00260             /* Found a match. Set memory mapping params only. */
00261             s = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfSection*>(possible[j]);
00262             if (!s) continue; /*potential match was not from the ELF Section or Segment table*/
00263             if (s->get_segment_entry()) continue; /*potential match is assigned to some other segment table entry*/
00264             s->init_from_segment_table(shdr, true); /*true=>set memory mapping params only*/
00265         }
00266 
00267         /* Create a new segment if no matching section was found. */
00268         if (!s) {
00269             if (SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_NOTE == shdr->get_type()) {
00270                 s = new SgAsmElfNoteSection(fhdr);
00271             } else {
00272                 s = new SgAsmElfSection(fhdr);
00273             }
00274             s->init_from_segment_table(shdr);
00275             s->parse();
00276         }
00277     }
00278     return this;
00279 }
00280 
00290 SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry *
00291 SgAsmElfSegmentTable::add_section(SgAsmElfSection *section)
00292 {
00293     ROSE_ASSERT(section!=NULL);
00294     ROSE_ASSERT(section->get_file()==get_file());
00295     ROSE_ASSERT(section->get_header()==get_header());
00296     ROSE_ASSERT(section->get_segment_entry()==NULL);            /* must not be in the segment table yet */
00297 
00298     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());
00299     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr);
00300     
00301     /* Assign a slot in the segment table */
00302     int idx = fhdr->get_e_phnum();
00303     fhdr->set_e_phnum(idx+1);
00304 
00305     /* Create a new segment table entry */
00306     SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry *shdr = new SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry;
00307     shdr->set_index(idx);
00308     shdr->update_from_section(section);
00309     section->set_segment_entry(shdr);
00310 
00311     return shdr;
00312 }
00313 
00316 rose_addr_t
00317 SgAsmElfSegmentTable::calculate_sizes(size_t *entsize, size_t *required, size_t *optional, size_t *entcount) const
00318 {
00319     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());
00320     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr!=NULL);
00321 
00322     size_t struct_size = 0;
00323     size_t extra_size = fhdr->get_phextrasz();
00324     size_t entry_size = 0;
00325     size_t nentries = 0;
00326 
00327     /* Size of required part of each entry */
00328     if (4==fhdr->get_word_size()) {
00329         struct_size = sizeof(SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::Elf32SegmentTableEntry_disk);
00330     } else if (8==fhdr->get_word_size()) {
00331         struct_size = sizeof(SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::Elf64SegmentTableEntry_disk);
00332     } else {
00333         throw FormatError("bad ELF word size");
00334     }
00335 
00336     /* Entire entry should be at least large enough for the required part. */
00337     entry_size = struct_size;
00338 
00339     /* Size of optional parts. If we've parsed the table then use the largest optional part, otherwise assume the entry from
00340      * the ELF File Header is correct. */
00341     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList sections = fhdr->get_sections()->get_sections();
00342     for (size_t i=0; i<sections.size(); i++) {
00343         SgAsmElfSection *elfsec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfSection*>(sections[i]);
00344         if (elfsec && elfsec->get_segment_entry()) {
00345             nentries++;
00346             extra_size = std::max(extra_size, elfsec->get_segment_entry()->get_extra().size());
00347         }
00348     }
00349 
00350     /* Total number of entries. Either we haven't parsed the segment table yet (nor created the segments it defines) or we
00351      * have. In the former case we use the setting from the ELF File Header, otherwise we just count the number of segments
00352      * that have associated segment table entry pointers. */
00353     if (0==nentries)
00354         nentries = fhdr->get_e_phnum();
00355 
00356     /* Return values */
00357     if (entsize)
00358         *entsize = entry_size;
00359     if (required)
00360         *required = struct_size;
00361     if (optional)
00362         *optional = extra_size;
00363     if (entcount)
00364         *entcount = nentries;
00365     return entry_size * nentries;
00366 }
00367 
00369 bool
00370 SgAsmElfSegmentTable::reallocate()
00371 {
00372     bool reallocated = false;
00373 
00374     /* Resize based on word size from ELF File Header */
00375     size_t opt_size, nentries;
00376     rose_addr_t need = calculate_sizes(NULL, NULL, &opt_size, &nentries);
00377     if (need < get_size()) {
00378         if (is_mapped()) {
00379             ROSE_ASSERT(get_mapped_size()==get_size());
00380             set_mapped_size(need);
00381         }
00382         set_size(need);
00383         reallocated = true;
00384     } else if (need > get_size()) {
00385         get_file()->shift_extend(this, 0, need-get_size(), SgAsmGenericFile::ADDRSP_ALL, SgAsmGenericFile::ELASTIC_HOLE);
00386         reallocated = true;
00387     }
00388 
00389     /* Update data members in the ELF File Header. No need to return true for these changes. */
00390     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());
00391     fhdr->set_phextrasz(opt_size);
00392     fhdr->set_e_phnum(nentries);
00393 
00394     return reallocated;
00395 }
00396 
00398 void
00399 SgAsmElfSegmentTable::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
00400 {
00401     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());
00402     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr!=NULL);
00403     ByteOrder sex = fhdr->get_sex();
00404     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList sections = fhdr->get_segtab_sections();
00405 
00406     /* Write the segments first */
00407     for (size_t i=0; i<sections.size(); i++)
00408         sections[i]->unparse(f);
00409     unparse_holes(f);
00410 
00411     /* Calculate sizes. The ELF File Header should have been updated in reallocate() prior to unparsing. */
00412     size_t ent_size, struct_size, opt_size, nentries;
00413     calculate_sizes(&ent_size, &struct_size, &opt_size, &nentries);
00414     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr->get_phextrasz()==opt_size);
00415     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr->get_e_phnum()==nentries);
00416     
00417     /* Write the segment table entries */
00418     for (size_t i=0; i < sections.size(); ++i) {
00419         SgAsmElfSection *section = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfSection*>(sections[i]);
00420         ROSE_ASSERT(section!=NULL);
00421         SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry *shdr = section->get_segment_entry();
00422         ROSE_ASSERT(shdr!=NULL);
00423         ROSE_ASSERT(shdr->get_offset()==section->get_offset()); /*segment table entry should have been updated in reallocate()*/
00424 
00425         int id = shdr->get_index();
00426         ROSE_ASSERT(id>=0 && (size_t)id<nentries);
00427             
00428         SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::Elf32SegmentTableEntry_disk disk32;
00429         SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::Elf64SegmentTableEntry_disk disk64;
00430         void *disk = NULL;
00431         
00432         if (4==fhdr->get_word_size()) {
00433             disk = shdr->encode(sex, &disk32);
00434         } else if (8==fhdr->get_word_size()) {
00435             disk = shdr->encode(sex, &disk64);
00436         } else {
00437             ROSE_ASSERT(!"invalid word size");
00438         }
00439         
00440         /* The disk struct */
00441         rose_addr_t spos = write(f, id*ent_size, struct_size, disk);
00442         if (shdr->get_extra().size() > 0)
00443             write(f, spos, shdr->get_extra());
00444     }
00445 }
00446 
00448 void
00449 SgAsmElfSegmentTable::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00450 {
00451     char p[4096];
00452     if (idx>=0) {
00453         sprintf(p, "%sSegmentTable[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00454     } else {
00455         sprintf(p, "%sSegmentTable.", prefix);
00456     }
00457 
00458     SgAsmGenericSection::dump(f, p, -1);
00459 
00460     if (variantT() == V_SgAsmElfSegmentTable) //unless a base class
00461         hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"data at ", p_data);
00462 }
